passages.text: **Brunello Cucinelli**

Brunello Cucinelli reported 1H25 results earlier today. This report contains key points from its investor conference call. **Results Quick Take**: Brunello Cucinelli 1H25 results beat tight **consensus**

**Overall Impression**: Brunello Cucinelli continues defying the odds with his very straight-forward strategy of selling gentle luxury to their 500k HNWI customers and maintaining their loyalty through small gestures and personal touches. Brunello gave the floor to the two company CEOs - Luca Lisandroni and Riccardo Stefanelli - more than in previous earnings calls, as he was calling in from Prague where he was attending one of the company's exclusive ~150 client events. Case in point.

**Current trading remains solid and well-balanced across geographies pointing towards** a 3Q25E in line with 2Q25. The +5% price increase in the US as a result of tariffs did not affect sales and all markets, including China, continue to perform well. As a result, guidance for +10% growth with healthy and balanced profits has been reiterated for FY25E. Several high profile communication events in 4Q25E, like the takeover of the Harrods windows in December and January reinforce this optimism. Given the S/S 2026 sales campaigns and menswear collections are performing 'excellently', company outlook for FY26E growth also remains +10%.

**The early completion in November of the three-year program for artisanal made-in-** **Italy production, which includes the doubling of the Solomeo factory and the new artisan** factories in Penne and Gubbio, ensures production that will support their +6/7% volume growth algorithm until around 2035. Investments (% sales) are guided to return to 7% in FY26E and FY27E after reaching an estimated 10.5% in FY25E.

**We rate Brunello Cucinelli Market-Perform, PT 118€, as we believe it is priced to** perfection (Global Luxury Goods: A valuation deep-dive), but expect it to react positively tomorrow given the earnings beat and accumulated short interest of ~7%. We remain cautious on the LT because we struggle to see how they will be able to retain their brand equity and exclusivity, given the brand discounts available online and in stores, for one.
(Brunello Cucinelli: The right way to build heritage - Initiating with a Market-Perform rating).

Price Performance, 1YR
-BC.IM - Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large & Mid Cap Price Return Index

- July and August sales maintained the very positive trend that has accompanied them for the beginning of the year. This sets the stage for a very good 3Q result and an excellent start for the winter collections. Products are highly appreciated by customers. Management think they will produce a steady growth in 3Q25E, in line with 2Q25. Brunello Cucinelli is growing well across the board. This is encouraging, given the F/W collection has been in stores since early July.

- In North America the situation has been very good. New collection means new prices (+5%), and these had no material effect on the customer willingness to buy and sales results. When the product price is \(\) 3,000\(, it does not make a big difference. Prices are increased every 6 months when distributing the collections to wholesalers, so prices will remain as they are today.
- In Europe, they experienced a strong summer from domestic customers and tourists alike.
- Similarly, the situation in Asia has been 'excellent'. China has been very positive across all regions. Japan is going back to its essence, so a primarily domestic market.

- In China they never perceived a lack of traffic in their stores. They see excellent traffic in China from both new and loyal existing customers. There is no radical change in terms of footfall in stores. Management sees a continuity regarding growth in the region compared to 1H25. Customers are on the lookout for special garments and this is particularly true in China. The lookout for exclusivity will be important to drive growth in the coming year.
- In terms of geo-pricing, Brunello Cucinelli stands at 100 Europe, 125 America and 128 Asia.

- The 'very, very positive sales trend in July and August, in continuity with the growth of the first six months, as well as the excellent start to the Fall-Winter '25 collections in our boutiques', gives management confidence to guide for a FY25E revenue growth of \(\sim 10\%\) , with healthy and balanced profits.
- Given the Spring-Summer 2026 sales campaigns are performing 'excellently', company outlook for FY26E growth is \(\sim 10\%\) as well.

- The men's collection has been released and has been extremely successful. Feedback from journalists has been positive. For womenswear they are only halfway through the collection so need to wait until September. If the international press decrees that the collection is not contemporary, then this will be an issue.
- Expecting an increase in Gross Margin in 2H25E as a result of channel mix and operating leverage.
- Marketing expenses are expected to remain flattish as a % of sales for 2H25 at \(\sim 7\%\) .
- Investments in FY26E and FY27E will return to \(\sim 7\%\) of sales as usual.

- Net financial position of €197.2m reflects the same increase of \(\sim \epsilon 100m\) that they achieved in FY24, given the number was close to 0 in FY23. This is due to investments and dividend payments. €197.2m is a good proxy for the net financial position of FY25E.

2025 represents an important year for investments. The early completion in November (one year ahead of plan) of the three- year program for artisanal made- in- Italy production, which includes the doubling of the Solomeo factory and the new artisan factories in Penne and Gubbio, ensures production that will support their \(+6 / 7\%\) volume growth algorythm until around 2035.
- Investments totaled €63.5 million in 1H25 (9.3% sales), vs €44.8 million in 1H24 (7.2%).
- €32.1m were the important trade investments to support the image of the Casa di Moda and the expansion of their showrooms and renovations
- €24.4m were due to other very important investments for the strengthening of the production artisanal capabilities
- €7m were invested in technologies

- The new factories have been set up mainly for men's blazers because they are extremely difficult to create as a garment and in Penne there is a sort of academy of the Brioni brand that brought about all this. Proper men's blazers can only be made in Italy and it is not an easy task. Womens blazers are slightly easier.
- More and more customers ask to visit and tour the plants and factories, and the team is 'very happy to accommodate this wish'.

- Brunello Cucinelli enjoys a direct relationship and frequent communication with their 400 suppliers, that employ 8,700 people in total with an average age of 43. The owners average age is \(\sim 49\) , which suggests the new generation has taken over, which is encouraging.

- \(70\%\) of these workshops work exclusively with Brunello Cucinelli, while the others collaborate with French brands, which produce \(\sim 70\%\) of their goods in Italy. And this enhances the value and the worth of this artisanal supply chain even more and not just for Italy but also for the foreign brands.
- The value of quality and craftsmanship in their products is key - \(62\%\) of manufacturing is manual work.
- Cucinelli want to be less known tomorrow than today in order to maintain their exclusivity perception.
- In order to respond to luxury market challenges, management has:
- maintained a very well-balanced pricing policy. Believe a \(3 - 4\%\) price increase is a sound pricing policy.

- continued organizing events and investing in people. There is nothing more effective than meeting people in person. Cucinelli has received very good customer reactions after writing thank you notes to those who attended their exclusive events. Regardless of the country where they organise their events, this doesn't change. They are expanding the size of their stores because they want to dedicate time and attention to all customers.
- Management does not perceive any risk from the availability of products at a discount.

- \(42\%\) of sales come from multi-brand stores, who are the custodians/guardians of their products. If they do not like the products, the brand is ruined. They get to judge the collections and give feedback, on which the company bases its guidance. This is Brunello Cucinelli's strategy on keeping the collections contemporary. If one is not courageous enough to listen to them, then they go bankrupt in a couple of years.

- When it comes to exclusivity, this is the difference between a Vacheron Constantin watch and an iPhone. One is an exclusive product, the other is a desirable product. A few discounts in the market have no impact on the exclusivity of the brand as it stands today.

- Their latest advert is centered around reading and books and has received a lot of positive feedback. The point is to resort back to the value of books and eternity. The opening of the Universal Library in Solomeo is high on Brunello's agenda.

- Brunello Cucinelli remains a no-logo company. Products with logo, like a tennis t-shirt or a towel are lifestyle products they use for merchandising. There is no change in strategy. They will remain a no-logo company.
Gross Margin remains unchanged at \(74.5\%\) as a result of an unchanged sales mix vs. last year.
Operating costs are up \(+8.5\%\) YoY, mirroring the expansion of the company.
Communication expenses were at \(6.5\%\) of sales, compared to \(7.3\%\) in 1H24, given the concentration of marketing events in 2H25E this year:

In October, Brunello will spend a week between Japan and Korea at various events- The "Outstanding Achievement Award" will be presented to Brunello Cucinelli by the British Fashion Council, on the 1st of December in London;- A total takeover of the windows at Harrods in London that will last for whole of December and January is planned. This should accompany sales that peak in the last quarter of the year, also taking into account the higher average prices.- The red carpet premiere of the documentary film "Brunello, il visionario garbato", dedicated to the life and work of the founder is set for the \(4^{\text{th}}\) of December at Cinecitta in Rome. The movie is directed by none other than Giuseppe Tornatore.

The increase in Financial charges/(income) related to "recurring management" by \(+54.5\%\) to €20.4m is mainly due to the financial charges calculated on the liabilities for leasing relating to the new openings and renewals of some stores.
NwC is equal to \(23.2\%\) vs. \(19.3\%\) in 1H24:

Trade receivables increased by \(+24.3\%\) mostly due to the excellent performance in revenues in 2Q25 with particular reference to the wholesale channel.- The incidence of inventories on the rolling revenues is equal to \(28.2\%\) , similar to FY24E. Management deems this level sound and normal for their business.
An increase of 262 FTEs reflects the targeted expansion of their retail network and also the strengthening of the production personnel pertaining to the increase in internal production.

Store openings that have been confirmed for 2H25E are: IFC Pudong Shanghai, Macau and the Abu Dhabi Galleria store. They are also bringing forward by a few months a street boutique in Carmel- by- the- Sea, one of California's iconic locations.
Added to this are the relocations and enlargements in Paris and Geneva, after the expansion of the Vienna store in 1H25.

The opening of 1- 2 stores in China is planned for the coming years alongside possible enlargements. Management expect they can also achieve healthy comparable growth in existing stores. They have decided not to accelerate store openings in distribution or the communication pace, as everything risks to be naturally faster in China given how hyper- connected everyone is.

The opening of Casa Cucinelli in Shanghai is scheduled for 2H26E and it is a very traditional Chinese home that has been refurbished impeccably in a particularly fascinating location, where traditional homes are surrounded by skyscrapers. The opening of the Casa Cucinelli can be a very important tool to promote a deep knowledge of the brand.
Management is envisaging 3- 4 openings in FY26E and 3- 4 enlargements, approaching this with enthusiasm, balance and sobriety.
We rate Brunello Cucinelli Market- Perform, PT 118€.

On April 1, 2024, Société Générale (SG) and AllianceBernstein, L.P. (AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.
We value Brunello Cucinelli on a target 3.50x relative P/E multiple to the MSCI Europe, applied to a blended 24M forward EPSforecast, arriving at a target price of 118€.

1. Continued out-performance amid current market volatility and different fashion cycles  
2. Phasing out of discounts and outlet closures  
3. Consistent improvement in key KPIs - store productivity, inventories, FCF
1. Brunello stepping down from managing the company could lead to instability and a looser control over production/wholesale partners;
2. Failure to convincingly innovate could push the brand in a 'classic corner', a possible risk if the aesthetics pendulum swings away
from 'quiet luxury';
3. Lower brand momentum could push more product into wholesale and 'boutiques previous season', which would impact brand equity.

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:

Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within \(+ / - 15\) pp Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI) index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non- Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:

Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within \(+ / - 10\) pp Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon. Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments. Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12- month time horizon.
